page.title: 19A Typical Day
page.content: I am usually awakened by the alarm clock at about 7am. After getting dressed I wake my three children and give them their breakfast of toast, cereal and a cup of tea. I see them off to school at about 8.20am. After washing up and making the beds I go in to Bingley to shop. On Tuesday I call at the Post Office for my Child Benefit Allowance of Â£20.55. On my return home I do the washing in the washing machine before having lunch, usually a cup of coffee and a sandwich. I then vacuum and dust in the sitting room and kitchen before getting ready to visit my mother in her flat nearby. I return by 4pm to give the children tea and my husband his dinner. After the meal I garden, read or perhaps attend a Sunday School meeting.
